overview: From 2025-09-09 to 2025-09-10, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 18 new PRs (9 merged), 8 new issues, and 28 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-sync-tester,op-acceptance-tests: sync test using the sync-tester
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body:
Add sync acceptance tests using the sync tester.

---

sysgo → easier to config because while we are booting the system, we may make a preset to enable/disable space.

@pcw109550 's suggestion is that, to make a minimal feedback loop to test, lets do in sysgo with activation of isthmus.

- [x] sysgo → simple

1. Spawn EL, CLA with isthmus enabled
2. Spawn Sync tester
3. Connect the CLB with the Sync tester
4. And make sure the CLB connected with the Sync Tester advances(syncs)

CLB ↔ Sync-Tester ↔ EL ↔ CLA 

- [ ] sysgo(extension to sysext can be done in follow up work)  → real data(op-mainnet etc)

1. hardcode the public endpoint (or OP Labs internal EL endpoint) to the test and give this to the initialization of the sync tester.
2. we may spawn CL to test
3. Make CL to sync until isthmus(or hf block - 1)
4. Check CL correctly advances after new hardfork

---

Test case Ideas(ordered by priority)

- [ ] Check every OP Stack HF transitions, not only Isthmus, but all HFs for real data.
- [ ] Multiple CLs, Single Sync Tester: Each CLs will initialize their own mock EL endpoints given by the sync tester. This validates that multiple CLs can sync together.
- [ ] User Tx with Sync Tester: Current tests only sync blocks which only contain deposit tx. Create user tx inside L2 blocks and check the L2CLs are synced also.

topIssues.title: create a new sequencer in mainnet with flashblocks called op-opn-geth-f-sequencer-3
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: This will ensure an odd number of voters in the finally Raft conductor set in mainnet.

topIssues.title: Remove prod-mainnet-sequencer-0 as a voter in mainnet
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: That's because it's anyway non-nvme and intentionally kept to be non-flashblocks oriented. Therefore, it will act like a backup sequencer in case of Flashblocks-catastrophes.

topPRs.title: Compose TimelockGuard and LivenessModule2 into a single contract
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
**Description**

`TimelockGuard` and `LivenessModule2` are inherited into a single contract. The primary purpose of which is to avoid the need to deploy and manage two different contracts.

Also makes the parent contracts abstract in order to prevent deploying
them individually.


Since their functionality is otherwise distinct, the child contract contains none of its own logic. The benefit of this approach is that it ensures the logic is available
in both contracts, while ensuring that their state and logic are kept
separate thus reducing the complexity and review effort.

Tests are kept separate for the same reason.

topPRs.title: TimelockGuard add basic configuration functionality
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
**Description**

This is the first PR in a forthcoming stack (expect 1 or 2 more PRs), which establishes the outline of the TimelockGuard contract.

It fully implements and tests the following functions of the TimelockGuard listed in the [specs](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/761):

- `viewTimelockGuardConfiguration`
- `configureTimelockGuard`
- `clearTimelockGuard`
- `cancellationThreshold`

It also includes empty placeholders for the following functions: 
- `scheduleTransaction`
- `checkTransaction`
- `checkPendingTransactions`
- `rejectTransaction`
- `rejectTransactionWithSignature`
- `cancelTransaction`

This PR does not combine the TimelockGuard and LivenessModule2, that is done in #17402.

topPRs.title: feat: move cannon and dispute to L1 folder
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: Moves the cannon and dispute folders to the L1 folder for structural clarity.

topPRs.title: feat: set up OPCM for U17
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body: This PR removes U16 code from the OPCM and updates it to work for U17. Various tests have been updated to support this, and the OPCM has been improved so that it can be more easily utilized by future maintainers.

topPRs.title: op-acceptance-tests: upgrade tests with real-data (op-sepolia)
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
This PR is adding upgrade tests for op-node via the op-sync-tester and real-world data from OP Sepolia.

Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/16703

completedItems.body: Get version of impls from the impl contracts themselves, reduce bytecode

completedItems.title: fix: bump validator version on develop
completedItems.body: This PR bumps the version for the StandardValidator on develop. The version in the 4.1.0 proposal branch is 1.13.0 and this version includes changes that are not on the proposal branch, so this version will be 1.14.0.
